TEXT: e1: I think Fritz has never been in a fight in his life.
CN RELATION: Fritz, never in fight (HasProperty)/Fritz, fight (NotPartOf)/Fritz, be in a fight (NotCapableOf)

TEXT: e2: As a boy he did use to scuffle with the other choirboys,
CN RELATION: Fritz, boy (IsA)/Fritz, choirboy (IsA)/Fritz, scuffle with choirboys (CapableOf)/choirboys, scuffle (CapableOf)

TEXT: e3: but that hardly counts as a proper brawl.
CN RELATION: scuffle with choirboys, proper brawl (NotIsA)/scuffle, brawl (NotIsA)

TEXT: e4: And he always chickens out when things get dicey.
CN RELATION: Fritz, chicken out when things get dicey (CapableOf)/things getting dicey, chickening out (Causes)

TEXT: e5: Yesterday, when the bouncer wouldn't let us in, he was suddenly gone.

MISSING INFORMATION 1: Scuffles do not count as a fight.

MISSING INFORMATION 2: If you get out of dicey situations, you don't need to fight.
